title: Use The Formula to Compute
text: Given any parabola in the form $${ax}^2+bx+c$$, the axis of symmetry is the vertical line $$x=\frac{-b}{2} a$$.
speech: Given any parabola in the form  a x squared, plus b x plus c , the axis of symmetry is the vertical line  x is equal to, fraction, negative b, over 2,  a .
pacedSpeech: Given any parabola in the form   a x squared, plus b x plus c
, the axis of symmetry is the vertical line   x is equal to, fraction, negative b, over 2,  a

title: Substitute The Value Into the Equation
text: $$a=-1$$, $$b=2$$, so $$x=\frac{-b}{2a}=\frac{-2}{2\left(-1\right)}=1$$. $$x=1$$ is the axis of symmetry.
speech: a is equal to, negative 1 ,  b, is equal to 2 , so  x, is equal to fraction, negative b, over, 2 a,  is equal to fraction, negative 2, over, 2 times negative 1,  is equal to 1 .  x, is equal to 1  is the axis of symmetry.
